clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of AS012 in Subjects With Non-segmental Vitiligo
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Randomized, Double Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Dose-Ranging Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of AS012 in Subjects With Non-segmental Vitiligo

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, double blind, placebo-controlled, phase II study. The study will be performed as a multicenter, multinational study. I

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline in Vitiligo Area Scoring Index score
primary_outcome.description: Vitiligo Area Scoring Index score: numeric score that can range from 0 to 100, with higher VASI scores denoting poorer the disease state

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline in Vitiligo Extent Score
secondary_outcome.description: Natural distribution of vitiligo on body reﬂecting 6 different degrees of involvement (1 percent, 5 percent, 10 percent, 25 percent, 50 percent, 75 percent).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change in Vitiligo Impact Patient scale
secondary_outcome.description: subjects will be asked to complete a questionnaire to assess the burden experienced by individuals affected. Summary scores range from 0 to 100
Score 0=no involvement or Score 1=limited extent with at least 2-point reduction from baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change, from baseline, in Dermatology Life Quality Index
secondary_outcome.description: The DLQI scores are based on the response from the patient. Each question is scored from 0 (not affected at all) to 3 (very much affected). The DLQI is calculated by summing the score of each question resulting in a maximum of 30 and a minimum of 0. The higher the score, the more quality of life is impaired OR lower scores indicate better quality of life.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Provide written informed consent.
2. Male or female ≥ 18 years of age at time of screening
3. Stable (without new patches ≥ 1 year) or unstable (with new patches for the last 1 year) vitiligo
4. VASI of ≥ 4 at screening and baseline
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Segmental vitiligo, focal, or mixed Vitiligo
2. Subjects who have high risk of suicidality at the Screening assessment based on Investigator's judgment
3. History of alcohol or drug abuse in the previous 2 years
4. Subjects who were submitted to melanocyte transfer
